InfoWithReference.title: InfoWithReference
InfoWithReference.description: A piece of information that includes a value and a list of source references.

value.description: The textual value of the information.

references.description: A list of URLs pointing to the sources of the information.

DrugHighlight.title: DrugHighlight
DrugHighlight.description: Represents a drug highlight for a specific date, containing detailed information about the drug with references.

id.description: Unique identifier for the DrugHighlight entity. Serves as the document ID in Firestore (Date in YYYY-MM-DD format).

definition.description: Stores drug highlights. The 'date' parameter serves as the document ID (YYYY-MM-DD format).

params.name: date
params.description: Date in YYYY-MM-DD format, serving as the document ID.

firestore.reasoning:
Given the requirement for a 'PIN-Protected Edit Mode' and the nature of the data (drug highlights by date), the most straightforward structure is to store drug highlights in a top-level collection, using the date as the document ID. This simplifies data retrieval and updates. 

**Authorization Independence:** Since no user-specific data or complex access control is mentioned, and a simple PIN-based edit mode is used, denormalization isn't strictly necessary at this level.  If more granular user-based access controls are added in the future, a separate collection to store authorized editor UIDs (or a similar mechanism) can be introduced.

**QAPs:**  This structure inherently supports simple `list` operations since all documents share the same security posture (date-based entries).
